articles.description: As Manchester City's 115 charges are due to be heard next month, Premier League chief Richard Masters says it is "time to resolve" the case.
articles.title: Man City 115 charges: Premier League chief says 'time to resolve' case

articles.description: Aaron Wan-Bissaka completes a £15m move to West Ham from Manchester United.
articles.title: Aaron Wan-Bissaka: West Ham sign Manchester United defender for £15m

articles.description: England Test captain Ben Stokes is ruled out of the remainder of The Hundred after sustaining a hamstring injury.
articles.title: Ben Stokes: Northern Superchargers' England captain ruled out of The Hundred with hamstring injury

articles.description: England attacking midfielder Cole Palmer signs a new Chelsea contract to extend his stay at Stamford Bridge to 2033.
articles.title: Cole Palmer: Chelsea attacking midfielder signs two-year contract extension to 2023

articles.description: James Anderson says he is "still fit enough" to continue his career as he considers a move into white ball cricket.
articles.title: James Anderson: England great 'open' to continuing career in white ball cricket

articles.description: Fantasy football tip for 2024-25, including whether you can squeeze Mohamed Salah and Erling Haaland into the same line-up.
articles.title: FPL 2024/25: Tips, rule changes, a new mystery chip and Salah or Haaland for your Gameweek 1 team

articles.description: Former Watford striker Troy Deeney is taking over from Garth Crooks this season in picking the Premier League Team of the Week for BBC Sport.
articles.title: Troy Deeney: I'm taking over from Garth Crooks for BBC Sport's Team of the Week

articles.description: Formula 1 is taking its summer break, but our correspondent Andrew Benson is still answering your questions.
articles.title: F1 Q&A: Grands prix under threat and should Ferrari and McLaren focus on 2026?

articles.description: To mark South Asian Heritage Month, BBC Sport takes a look at four athletes, in Britain and across the world, who are trailblazers their sport.
articles.title: South Asian Heritage Month: From cricket to weightlifting, four athletes trailblazing in their sport

articles.description: Despite new evidence, the Court of Arbitration for Sport (Cas) won't review a ruling that led to US gymnast Jordan Chiles being stripped of a bronze medal at Paris Olympics.
articles.title: Jordan Chiles: Ruling that led to Olympics bronze being stripped will not by reviewed
